body:
I agree with @dsymonds. This started as a documentation issue -- the tag
listed in the docs tends to lag behind the latest released version of Go --
can we solve it as a documentation issue instead. ie, use something like
$RELEASE_TAG, so the documentation becomes

   git clone https://go.googlesource.com/go -r $RELEASE_TAG

Then we just (ha) have to document how to construct a valid value of
$RELEASE_TAG.

On Fri, Jan 22, 2016 at 10:12 AM, Chris Broadfoot <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> Yes, I think that's correct, @dsymonds <https://github.com/dsymonds>. The
> branch would have a different commit (since it'd have a merge commit), but
> would be functionally the same.
>
> I suppose the use case is people that want to build from source but don't
> want to look up the latest version. Is that worth it?
